title: 107_s1138
content:
Retirement credit for government service performed abroad. Retirement credit under chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, is allowed for service performed by an individual at a United States diplomatic mission abroad under a temporary appointment. Retirement credit is allowed for service performed at a US diplomatic mission abroad under certain conditions, including family member limited noncareer appointments and meeting specific deposit requirements. Retirement credit is granted for service at a US diplomatic mission abroad if the individual meets specific requirements, including a minimum of 90 days of service. Retirement credit is granted for service at a US diplomatic mission abroad if the individual meets specific requirements, including a minimum of 90 days of service. SEC. 2. REQUIREMENTS. To receive credit under chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, for service at a US diplomatic mission abroad, the individual must file an application with the Office of Personnel Management within 36 months of the effective date of the regulations and remit the total amount that should have been deducted from their pay for the service. The individual must remit the total amount of Government contributions for service at a US diplomatic mission abroad to the Office of Personnel Management, in addition to any other required payments under chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code. The remittance of Government contributions for service at a US diplomatic mission abroad must be made to the Office of Personnel Management in accordance with specific regulations and requirements, including interest calculations as prescribed by the Office. If an instrumentality no longer exists, the amount owed will be considered part of a supplemental liability under title 5, United States Code. The Office of Personnel Management is responsible for informing individuals about their entitlement to have service credited or annuity computed under the Act. They must also assist individuals in obtaining necessary information from government agencies to verify their entitlement. The Office of Personnel Management is responsible for informing individuals about their entitlement to have service credited or annuity computed under the Act. Any department, agency, or instrumentality of the United States possessing relevant information must provide it to the Office upon request. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS.

    For purposes of this Act--
            (1) "Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund" or "Fund" refers to the Fund under section 8348 of title 5, United States Code;
            (2) "abroad" is defined under section 102 of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 (22 U.S.C. 3902);
            (3) "temporary appointment" means an appointment limited to a period of one year or less; and
            (4) "basic pay" is defined under section 8401 of title 5, United States Code.

SEC. 4. RULE OF CONSTRUCTION.

    This Act does not allow or require contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund that would not have been permitted or required without this Act.

SEC. 5. APPLICABILITY. Annuities commencing on or after the effective date of implementing regulations will be computed based on all service described in section 1. For annuities with a commencement date before the effective date, recomputation cases will apply. Annuities based on service described in section 1 will be recomputed for individuals with service performed in that section. For annuities that require this service for entitlement and would have started before the effective date, computation will also consider this service. The computation of annuities based on service described in section 1 will consider all relevant service performed by the individual. Any retroactive recomputation of annuities will be effective from the commencement date of the annuity or survivor annuity. Lump-sum payments for preceding months may be payable as a result of the recomputation. Lump-sum payments for retroactive annuity recomputations preceding the effective date may be payable in the form of a lump-sum payment. Order of precedence applies to payments for deceased individuals. The Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Secretary of State, will implement necessary regulations to carry out the Act.
